subclusters.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
Oxidative DNA Damage and Repair Deficiency Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on nuclear genomic instability, DNA damage response, cellular senescence, and stem cell exhaustion due to DNA damage accumulation and repair defects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage and Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on oxidative DNA lesions accumulation, impaired repair of oxidative damage, and their causal role in aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation and repair defects in hematopoietic stem cells leading to functional decline and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes somatic mutation accumulation due to nucleotide excision repair deficiency causing genome instability and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of DNA damage including oxidative lesions, decline of DNA repair pathways, and genomic instability driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Stress-Independent Longevity Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Distinct from DNA damage, this theory involves DVE-1 mediated longevity regulation independent of mitochondrial unfolded protein response.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Broad Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers accumulation of diverse molecular damages including DNA, proteins, lipids, and carbohydrates leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights DNA damage accumulation from endogenous and exogenous sources including chemotherapy accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genome instability, mutation and epimutation accumulation, and stem cell genome instability driving aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neural Network Functional Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on aging-related changes in brain functional connectivity and default mode network, distinct from DNA damage mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: rDNA Instability-Driven Somatic DNA Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genomic instability specifically at ribosomal DNA repeats as a primary driver of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details role of WRN helicase in DNA repair pathway choice and genome stability affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General theory of DNA damage accumulation causing genome instability, DDR activation, and aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Topoisomerase Regulation and Epigenetic Reprogramming Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on postdevelopmental downregulation of Top2/TOP2B affecting DNA topology and epigenetic landscape to extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Damage Accumulation and Repair Intervention Theory (SENS)
theory_assignments.reasoning: Conceptualizes aging as accumulated molecular damage treatable by engineered repair interventions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes DNA damage accumulation and impaired repair in plasma cells contributing to aging and multiple myeloma.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage and Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative DNA damage accumulation, tissue-specific effects, and causal role in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights replication stress response, RECQ helicases, and genome homeostasis as central to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses DNA damage accumulation, NER defects, and mutation spectrum changes in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Declining Selection Pressure Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: An evolutionary theory explaining aging via declining natural selection pressure with age, distinct from molecular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA repair decline, especially base excision repair, and its link to neurodegenerative diseases and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nuclear Genomic Instability and DNA Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General DNA damage accumulation theory emphasizing multiple DNA repair pathways and stem cell depletion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Alkylation-Induced Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses specifically on DNA alkylation damage causing permanent senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage and Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative DNA damage accumulation and critical role of base excision repair in longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative DNA Damage and Repair Deficiency Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on BER deficiency causing oxidative DNA damage accumulation and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue-Specific Cellular Senescence and Stem Cell Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decidual tissue aging via cellular senescence and stem cell exhaustion driving parturition, distinct from DNA damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Transcriptional Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on transcription-blocking DNA lesions causing gene length-dependent transcriptional shutdown during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Declining Selection Pressure Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains aging as accumulation of late-acting deleterious mutations due to declining force of natural selection.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Repair-Associated Epigenetic Drift Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links DNA damage repair to chromatin remodeling and stable age-related promoter DNA hypermethylation causing epigenetic drift.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Defective Protein Genetic Programming Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging results from defects in genetically programmed proteins regulating aging processes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage Accumulation and Cellular Senescence Threshold Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Mathematical model describing gene damage accumulation leading to loss of cell division and cell death thresholds.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Polymerase Alpha Dysfunction and Replication Initiation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related decline in DNA polymerase alpha activity impairing DNA replication initiation and causing senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Synthesis Initiation (DSI) Depletion Programmed Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes programmed aging via finite number of DNA synthesis initiation loci acting as a molecular clock for senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress Signaling Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging-related decline in ERK and Akt kinase activation reducing oxidative stress tolerance and cell survival.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: DNA Damage-Induced Transcription Stress and Metabolic Remodeling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how DNA damage-induced transcription arrest leads to ATP surplus, glycolysis inhibition, and antioxidant pathway activation.
